--- layout: default title: BSc (Hons) Progression Routes ---

BSc (Hons) Progression Routes

Graduates of the Specialist Technical College Level 5 Diploma have clear progression opportunities into recognised BSc (Hons) degrees at leading UK and Irish universities. These routes help bridge college study and university-level qualification, subject to each institution’s entry requirements.

Direct Progression Routes

United Kingdom — Bangor University (Wales)

Students may progress to relevant BSc (Hons) computing and technology degrees at Bangor University, including:

  • BSc (Hons) Computer Science (with foundations in programming, cybersecurity, algorithms, and systems)
  • BSc (Hons) Computer Information Systems

Explore undergraduate options: Bangor University undergraduate courses (select Computing & IT)

Ireland — Technological University Dublin (TU Dublin)

Our Level 5 Diploma offers a pathway into TU Dublin’s Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Computing – Digital Forensics and Cyber Security, a specialised cyber degree designed to develop practical skills in cybersecurity, digital forensics, secure systems, and network protection.

Course details: TU Dublin – Computing (Digital Forensics and Cyber Security)

Ireland — Atlantic Technological University (ATU)

Students can also progress to ATU’s Bachelor of Science in Computing with Cybersecurity and Digital Forensics, combining core computing knowledge with specialised cyber skills.

Programme info: ATU – Computing with Cybersecurity and Digital Forensics

Progression to these degrees is subject to standard entry criteria and availability at the receiving university. Students are encouraged to check specific requirements and application deadlines.

Typical Progression Pathway

Why These Progression Routes Matter

  • Build on your Level 5 foundation with university-level study.
  • Access internationally recognised degrees in computing and cyber security.
  • Enhance employment prospects in a growing tech and security job market.

Each progression route supports students in moving confidently from college into a full BSc (Hons) degree, preparing you for advanced study and professional opportunities.
